exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) p, q : list (Term A n) Hcanon_p : canonical A0 eqA ltM p Hcanon_q : canonical A0 eqA ltM q Hreduceplus : reduceplus Q (pluspf A0 (eqA:=eqA) plusA eqA_dec (ltM:=ltM) ltM_dec p q) (pO A n) H : eqP A eqA n (pluspf A0 (eqA:=eqA) plusA eqA_dec (ltM:=ltM) ltM_dec p q) (pO A n) Unable to unify "reduceplus ?M2247 ?M2248 ?M2249" with "reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q q q".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (p q : list (Term A n)), canonical A0 eqA ltM p -> canonical A0 eqA ltM q -> reduceplus Q (pluspf A0 (eqA:=eqA) plusA eqA_dec (ltM:=ltM) ltM_dec p q) (pO A n) -> exists r1 : list (Term A n), reduceplus Q p r1 /\ reduceplus Q q (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) r1)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
T1 : forall A : Type, A -> forall n : nat, Term A n
canonical : forall A : Type, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, (mon n -> mon n -> Prop) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop

```coq
intros Q p q Hcanon_p Hcanon_q Hreduceplus.
inversion Hreduceplus; subst.
- exists q. split.
  + apply Rstar_0. apply eqP_refl.
  + apply Rstar_n with (y:=q). assumption. apply Rstar_0. apply eqP_refl.
- destruct (rep_plus_zero_reduce Q x y H Hcanon_x p q H0 Hcanon_p Hcanon_q eq_refl eq_refl H1) as [r1 [Hred_p Hred_q]].
  exists r1. split; assumption.
Qed.                                            
```

original: intros Q p q Hcanon_p Hcanon_q Hreduceplus. inversion Hreduceplus; subst. - exists q. split. + apply Rstar_0. apply eqP_refl. + apply Rstar_n with (y:=q). auto. apply Rstar_0. apply eqP_refl. - destruct (rep_plus_zero_reduce Q x y H Hcanon_x p q H0 Hcanon_p Hcanon_q eq_refl eq_refl H1) as [r1 [Hred_p Hred_q]]. exists r1. split; auto.
